00001 // ORVTreeWriter.hh
00002 
00003 #ifndef _ORVTreeWriter_hh_
00004 #define _ORVTreeWriter_hh_
00005 
00006 #include <string>
00007 #include "TTree.h"
00008 #include "ORDataProcessor.hh"
00009 
00010 
00011 class ORVTreeWriter : public ORDataProcessor
00012 {
00013   public:
00014     enum EFillMethod { kFillAfterProcessDataRecord, kFillBeforeProcessDataRecord };
00015 
00016   public:
00017     ORVTreeWriter(ORVDataDecoder* decoder, std::string treeName = "");
00018     virtual ~ORVTreeWriter() {}
00019 
00020     virtual EReturnCode StartRun();
00021     virtual EReturnCode ProcessDataRecord(UInt_t* record);
00022     virtual EReturnCode EndRun();
00023     virtual void SetTreeName(std::string treeName) { fTreeName = treeName; }
00024 
00025     // The following functions set the automatic filling behavior of the
00026     // ORVTreeWriter. Note that ORVTreeWriters auto-fill the tree with
00027     // period 1 and method kFillAfterProcessDataRecord by default.
00028 
00029     // In some cases, several processors might be writing to the same tree.
00030     // However, only one processor should do the actual filling of the
00031     // tree. This behavior may be selected by calling
00032     // SetThisProcessorAutoFillsTree(true) for the processor in charge of tree
00033     // filling, and SetThisProcessorAutoFillsTree(false) for all other
00034     // processors.
00035     virtual void SetThisProcessorAutoFillsTree(bool fillTree = true);
00036 
00037     // Some devices send their information serially in a sequence of data
00038     // records. For example, a collection of 4 ADCs might send 4 contiguous
00039     // records, and you only want to fill the tree once every 4 times a
00040     // data record is received. This is achieved by SetFillPeriod(nRecords)
00041     // (e.g. nRecords = 4 for this example).
00042     virtual void SetFillPeriod(int nRecords) { fFillPeriod = nRecords; }
00043 
00044     // For a simple tree filled by a single processor, filling the tree
00045     // after each data record is processed is sufficient. In such cases,
00046     // users should call SetFillMethod(kFillAfterProcessDataRecord). This
00047     // is the default
00048     //
00049     // However, say you have a series of processors that are filling
00050     // the same tree (or an object to be saved to a tree), where the
00051     // arrival of one data record type (for example a GTID) marks when
00052     // a new row (e.g. event) begins.  In this case, you want the
00053     // filling of the tree to be postponed until right before the
00054     // processing of the next data record of that type. In such cases,
00055     // SetFillMethod(kFillBeforeProcessDataRecord) should be used.
00056     virtual void SetFillMethod(EFillMethod fillMethod) { fFillMethod = fillMethod; }
00057 
00058 
00062     virtual void SetSaveNonemptyTrees(bool saveNonemptyTrees = true) { fSaveOnlyNonemptyTrees = saveNonemptyTrees; }
00064     virtual bool GetSaveNonemptyTrees() { return fSaveOnlyNonemptyTrees; }
00065 
00066     // Provide a means to clear the fields to be filled to the tree when
00067     // there are multiple processors writing to the same tree. While this
00068     // function is not used within the autofilling routines, it can be useful
00069     // for compound processors
00070     virtual void Clear() = 0;
00071 
00072   protected:
00073     // Turn off auto filling: the derived class will explicitly fill the
00074     // tree. In this case, the tree must have a unique name. Note that this
00075     // function is only available to derived classes.
00076     virtual void SetDoNotAutoFillTree();
00077 
00078   protected:
00079     virtual EReturnCode InitializeTree();
00080     virtual EReturnCode InitializeBranches() = 0;
00081 
00082   protected:
00083     std::string fTreeName;
00084     TTree* fTree;
00085     bool fThisProcessorAutoFillsTree;
00086     bool fUniqueTree;
00087     int fFillPeriod;
00088     EFillMethod fFillMethod;
00089     int fFillCount;
00090     EReturnCode fLastProcessedRecordRetCode;
00091     Bool_t fSaveOnlyNonemptyTrees; 
00092 };
00093 
00094 #endif
